page.title: 03CHURCHES IN CHARLBURY
page.content: There are 6 churches in Charlbury and surrounding villages. Charlbury Baptist Church was built in 1853 and and will be extended in 1985. The Anglican Church in Charlbury is very old and was started in Norman times.There are six arches from early times and a Jacobean staircase. The Catholic Church is about 200 years old and has fine arched windows. The Methodist Church is small with a balcony and a pulpit. Upstairs there are Sunday School rooms and a kitchen. Shorthampton Church has wall paint- ings which had been covered for 350 years and it is very small. Spelsbury Church is quite big and was built by a Beauchamp.In 1775 the spire was taken down and never rebuilt. One of the Charlbury clergy visit school each week to talk to the pupils.
